thread.title: Gibson, Lamb lead C.B. East past Norristown
thread.title_full: Gibson, Lamb lead C.B. East past Norristown

title: Gibson, Lamb lead C.B. East past Norristown
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports But the most pivotal play the senior tailback made came on the first of quarterback Jack Lamb's four completed passes, which came at the end of an 18-play opening drive that took 18 minutes and used up nearly eight minutes.
The Patriots marched down the field from their own 35-yard line, converting two fourth downs. Gibson carried the ball 11 times for 52 yards on the drive. 
Yet the offense nearly hiccuped as CBE reached the red zone. 
On a third down and goal, from the 14-yard line, Lamb rolled out to his left in search of a target on his first pass of the game. 
He couldn't see a thing. 
Norristown defenders swarmed, arms raised and coming fast. 
But Lamb, a run-first quarterback, was prepared. 
He said after the game that the Patriots run plenty of scramble drills in practice, and it showed as he spun out of a defender's grip and looked to the right side of the field. 
There Gibson stood, waving his arms frantically, eager to bail his friend and teammate out of a jam. 
"They brought a lot of guys on that play, and Jack was just kind of scrambling around," Gibson said. "He did a great job with his feet, and luckily I was on the backside of the play, and we just kept it alive." 
Lamb managed to lob it to Gibson, who pivoted and was surprised to find no defenders between him and the end zone. 
It was the first of three touchdowns for Gibson, who Lamb said "has the ability to take it and score on any given play." 
This is the senior Gibson's first season at C.B. East with five wins in a season. He said the fifth win was a personal landmark victory. 
If he keeps running like he did Saturday, number six can't be far away. 
Central Bucks East 7 13 10 7 - 37 
Norristown 0 7 0 14 - 21 
CBE: Alex Gibson 14 pass from Jack Lamb (Kiel Kittleson kick) 
CBE: Gibson 11 run (Kittleson kick) 
CBE: FG Kittleson 24 
N: Khalif Sinclair 59 run (Shane Hammer kick) 
CBE: FG Barney Amor 39 
CBE: FG Kittleson 27 
CBE: Lamb 1 run (Kittleson kick)
